description: This course explores the diverse modes of inquiry in the discipline of political science.
Broadly centered around the question, "How do you know?," students focus on different
methods of locating and collecting data, reviewing political texts and contested
concepts, and constructing theoretical explanations of political phenomena. Offered each
semester. Also counts toward environmental studies major (social science emphasis) and business
studies concentration. Prerequisite: one previous course in department and a declared PSCI major.
